definition: to stop running (of flight of shipping service)/to suspend service (flight, sailing)/to interrupt schedule

sentences.english: The civil aviation authority has already approved Wang's application for the suspension.
sentences.chinese: 民航主管部门已批准王均金的书面停航申请。

sentences.english: The ship of China-US relations, moored for so long, again set sail, braving the wind and waves.
sentences.chinese: 停航许久的中美关系大船又乘风破浪启航了。

sentences.english: While suspending, power is offered by the diesel engine generator.
sentences.chinese: 停航时，由柴油发电机组提供。

sentences.english: Captain Cornish repeated his order to heave to.
sentences.chinese: 科尼什船长再次下达了停航的命令。

sentences.english: There was a blockage in supplies of food because no ships were sailing.
sentences.chinese: 由于船只停航，食品供应受到阻碍。

sentences.english: I stopped. What is the instruction?
sentences.chinese: 我船已经停航，给我船的指令是什么？

sentences.english: Flights to a number of destinations would be temporarily suspended.
sentences.chinese: 部分航线将会暂时停航。

sentences.english: When our ship received the signal, she hove to.
sentences.chinese: 我们的船接到信号后就顶风停航了。

sentences.english: Currently, the station has not received a suspended flights for more information.
sentences.chinese: 目前，该站还未接到更多的航班停航消息。

definition: scheduled flight/flight number/plane/scheduled sailing/sailing number/passenger ship
connected by air, sea traffic or service
to return to the point of departure
grade/class number (in school)/flight or run number/flight or run (seen as an item)/shift (work period)
regular passenger or cargo ship/regular steamship service
